item.title: Christina add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Violence harms the one who does it as much as the one who receives it. You could cut down a tree with an axe. The axe does violence to the tree, and escapes unharmed. Is that how you see it? Wood is soft compared to steel, but the sharp steel is dulled as it chops, and the sap of the tree will rust and pit it. The mighty axe does violence to the helpless tree, and is harmed by it. So it is with men, though the harm is in the spirit." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Christina add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "They're in love. Fuck the war." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Christina add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Christina add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Christina add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I'm a very ordinary human being; I just happen to like reading books." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Christina add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you can love someone with your whole heart, even one person, then there's salvation in life. Even if you can't get together with that person." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Christina add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Christina add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Love was action. It came to you. It was not a choice." -- Ann Patchett
